cscie160.hw3

Class Elevator

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie160.hw3.Elevator

  • public class Elevator
extends java.lang.Object
    Elevator simulation with passenger loading/unloading and building floor limits.
    Since:
    2011-10-03

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Elevator()
      Elevator constructor This constructor sets the starting floor and direction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Elevator

        public Elevator()
        Elevator constructor This constructor sets the starting floor and direction. It is also responsible for initializing state variables to track Floor objects and Passengers.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        main This code creates an Elevator object, boards passengers to the Elevator hw3 spec, then has the Elevator object sweep (move) to all floors in the building letting off passengers at their destinations and printing an Elevator status along the way. It also supports the Floor and Passenger classes which allows for registering passenger boarding requests.
        Parameters:
        args - No parameters are used here.

      • clearScreen

        public static void clearScreen()
        This method prints empty lines to the output to "clear" the screen.

      • printElevatorStatus

        public void printElevatorStatus()
        This method prints the status of the Elevator. This envokes the toString() method of the Elevator class and adds a little style. In addition, it also prints the status of each of the Passenger slots on the elevator, with the passenger's destination floor.

      • printFloorStatus

        public void printFloorStatus()
        This method prints the status of each floor. This envokes the toString() method of the Floor class and adds a little style. In addition, it also will mark the floor # with a * if the elevator is expected to stop in that direction. Note: there are two directions (up/down), and two separate arrays to tell the elevator when to stop.

      • registerRequest

        public void registerRequest(Passenger p)
        Registers a request with the floor to add a passenger to the queue. This method calls the floor object to increment the passenger waiting queue for that floor. It also marks the floor to be stopped at on the Elevator data member destinationFloor.
        Parameters:
        p - Passenger Pass passenger object to init passenger on floor

      • boardPassenger

        public void boardPassenger(Passenger p)
                    throws CapacityReachedException
        Boards a passenger on the Elevator. This method performs the action of boarding a passenger on the Elevator. This requires setting the floor passed as a parameter as a destination floor. This is done regardless if it was previously a destination floor or not. It then increments the number of passengers destined for that floor by 1.
        Parameters:
        p - Passenger object that includes current floor, destination floor.
        Throws:
        CapactiyReachedException - when elevator capacity has been reached.
        CapacityReachedException

      • unloadCurrentFloorPassengers

        public Passenger unloadCurrentFloorPassengers()
        Unloads a passenger to the current floor. This method iterates through the Elevator passengers, and unloads the first passenger it finds destined for the current floor. If a passenger is found, it removes that passenger from the Elevator ArrayList, and returns that object to the caller. If no passenger is found, null is returned.
        Returns:
        Passenger unloaded from Elevator. Null if no passengers are left to deboard.

      • move

        public void move()
        Move the Elevator through the floors. This method moves the Elevator through the floors in the building. It performs bounds checking by switching the direction if the Elevator has reached the top or the bottom of the building. In addition, this method also increments the currentFloor variable by a value of +1 or -1, depending on the currentDirection variable of the Elevator.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the Elevator and allow passengers to exit. When this method is called it clears the object state variables for the current floor. This includes setting the destination floor of the current floor to false, and clearing any queued passengers for this floor. After loading, a check is made to the floor to get the Passenger count. If it is more than 0 after loading then re-mark the floor for stopping to pick up the remaining passengers. Finally, it prints a status message about stopping on a floor, then calls the overloaded toString() method to print the Elevator status.

      • doSwitchDirection

        public void doSwitchDirection()
        Switches the direction of the Elevator This method performs bounds checking on the Elevator's current floor and, if necessary, will switch the direction.

      • isDestinationFloor

        public boolean isDestinationFloor()
        Validates if current floor is a destination floor. This method returns the true/false value of the currentFloor member of the destinationFloor array to indiciate if the currentFloor is a destination floor.
        Returns:
        true = floor is destination, false if not.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the status of the Elevator object This method is an overloaded toString method to return Elevator floor and passenger count.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Status containing passenger count and current floor

      • getPassengerCount

        public int getPassengerCount()
        Returns the count of passengers This method iterates through all of the buildling floors and totals the passengers destined for each floor. The method returns this count.
        Returns:
        passenger count on Elevator

      • getElevatorStatus

        public java.lang.String getElevatorStatus()
        Returns the status of the Elevator.
        Returns:
        Status of elevator (Moving, Stopped)

      • getCurrentFloor

        public int getCurrentFloor()
        Returns the current floor of the Elevator object This method returns the data member of the Elevator current floor value
        Returns:
        current floor of Elevator

      • getCurrentDirection

        public int getCurrentDirection()
        Returns the direction of the Elevator.
        Returns:
        direction of elevator (1 = up, -1 = down)
